intro: Phyteuma orbiculare var. comosum, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It prefers well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant color and compact form.
